rpReport’s Documentation¶

Indices and tables¶

Introduction¶

Welcome to rpReport’s documenation. This project parses rpSBML files to a single CSV report. The following information is returned:

  1. Global Score

  2. Rule Score

  3. dG:superscript:’o

  4. dG:superscript:’m

  5. dG Uncertainty

  6. FBA Flux results

  7. UniProt ID’s

  8. Selenzyme scores

Note that if any of that information is missing, then nothing is returned in the CSV.

Usage¶

First build the rpBase docker before building the local one:

docker build -t brsynth/rpreport-standalone:v2 .

The docker can be called locally using the following command:

python run.py -input input.tar -input_format tar -output output.csv

API¶

class rpTool.getInfo¶

Extract the required info from the BRSynth annotation

Parameters

  • brs_dict (dict) – The BRSynth dictionary

  • key (str) – The key to extract the info from

Return type

str

Returns

The extracted value

class rpTool.writeLine¶

Write the lines in the report from a rpSBML file

Parameters

  • rpsbml (rpSBML) – The input rpSBML object

  • csvfi (csv.writer) – The csv output file

  • pathway_id (str) – The id of the heterologous pathway

Return type

None

Returns

None

class rpToolServe.runReport_hdd¶

Generate the csv report file

Parameters

  • inputTar (str) – Input TAR file

  • csvfi_path (str) – Path to the output report file

  • pathway_id (str) – The id of the pathway (Default: rp_pathway)

Return type

bool

Returns

The success or failure of the function

class run.main¶

Call the docker object to run and generate the report

Parameters

  • inputfile (str) – The input file path

  • input_format (str) – The input file format (Valid Options: [‘tar’, ‘sbml’])

  • output (str) – The output file path

  • pathway_id (str) – The id of the heterologous pathway (Default: ‘rp_pathway’)

Return type

None

Returns

None
